supportDesc.condition: The Ms was resewn with modern synthetic threads. 1/3 of the front board is cut off. The leather cover is detached from the back board and completely torn off from the front board and spine; traces of leather are visible on the outer side of the front board. Some folios are stained with dirt (19v, 20r, 27v, 28r). 49 is cut at the bottom.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some leaves have one (54rv, 63r), some two (57rv, 60rv) additional bottom ruled line not used by the scribe.
45r has an additional crudely ruled line at the bottom, close to the edge of the folio.

handNote.seg:
Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist and of the angel Gabrǝʾel (fols. 20vb, 21va, 68vb, 76ra, 81rb); names of the donors (erased and replaced); elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I (alternating with black lines), two initial lines in the incipit of sections (homilies) and of subsections (miracles); the first word in the incipit of subsections (hymns), i.e. salām "salutation".

decoDesc.decoNote: 3r (incipit page Text I): coloured (red, black) ornamental band; anthropomorphic and geometric motifs, crosses.

f. 100v: Donation note. 100v: ተስፋ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ዘወ[ሀ]ቦ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ …
The note is very crudely written beneath Additio 1 and repeated on 101v. It states that Tasfā Mikāʾel donated the Ms. to the church of St Michael. Other persons, such as Walatta Ṣādǝqān, are also mentioned.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with dark-brown tooled leather (partly missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover is poorly visible (7 tools were used: triple line fillet, interlaced dot fillet, double circle, corni-form, small x, wave form with dots, cross hatching).
The inner side of both boards is decorated with paintings on cloth. It is unclear whether both boards with the painting were produced for this codex or they are reused parts of an icon.

person.persName: The name of the original donor has been erased throughout the Ms. and replaced with the names of “the servants” Ḫayla Takla Hāymānot, Gadla Mikāʾel and Surahe Krǝstos (e.g., 23va, 55vb; the name of Surahe Krǝstos was sometimes written in an unusual way, e.g., 14ra, 51ra, 56ra) and of “the maids” Fǝqǝrtä Takla Hāymānot and ʿƎśśetä Takla Hāymānot (e.g., 25va, 52vb, 73va, 88rb). Then again, the name of Surahe Krǝstos has been often erased (e.g., 8vb, 24vb, 45rb, 46vb, 51ra). According to Additio 2, the Ms. was some when donated by Tasfā Mikāʾel to the church.
